message.content:
We only include the cash paid (or received) when the company makes an acquisition or sale of long‐term non‐current assets. In our dataset the only “investing”‐related entry (aside from the “initial” transactions that are financing in nature) is the one with type “Fixed Assets Purchase”. (In the sample the “Initial Fixed Assets” entry was not counted in investing, only the separate “Fixed Assets Purchase” entry was.) 

For our problem the only investing activity is the row

  id = FixedAsset20231231001  type = Fixed Assets Purchase  amount = 106218.2

This transaction represents a cash outflow (a purchase of a fixed asset). Therefore, the net cash flow from investing activities is –106218.2.

Thus, the answer is:

{"solution": {'Net Cash Flow from Investing Activities': '-106218.2'} }
